info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 17 at 2:26PM CST until January 20 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON THURSDAY TO 6 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THURSDAY TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to two inches with the heaviest snow fall in northeast Nebraska. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will bring concerns for blowing snow and reduced visibility. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and west central Iowa and east central, northeast, and southeast Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from noon Thursday to 6 AM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM Thursday to noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and reduced visibility due to blowing snow. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Wrap pipes with insulation and seal windows to avoid loss of heat from your home. Keep a slow steady stream of water running from indoor faucets, and open cabinet doors to allow warm air to circulate around inside pipes.
